intro: Hedinia rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf hedinia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its rounded, waxy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
